CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1950, pg. 15, reads: "Painting Exhibit at Tavern - Earl Stewart, artist, and Joseph Robinson, proprietor of Crawford Grill Tavern No. 2, Elmore Street and Wylie Avenue, examine two of the many paintings on exhibit at the popular tavern. The exhibit which is being displayed by Stewart is usually shown to art lovers at "Everyman's Art Show" at the Arts and Crafts Center, Fifth and Shady Avenues.  The exhibit has also been shown in Florida and California.  Bill Robinson, the late tap dancer, who is portrayed in one of the paintings, sponsored the Florida Show. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Artist Earl Stewart and Joseph Robinson looking at Stewart's painting of Bill "Bojangles" Robinson, on display in Crawford Grill No. 2
